NF.Q: Between which pairs of nodes in column Consumption and column Processing is the flow between 2511 and 3504? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {3056} from node {Retail Purchase} to {Sorting}, a flow of {2511} from node {Food Preparation} to {Canning}, a flow of {2511} from node {Food Preparation} to {Grinding}, a flow of {2681} from node {Food Preparation} to {Packaging}.

NC.Q: Between the flows from node Food Waste to node Canning and from node Food Preparation to node Freezing, which path has a larger flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Food Waste} to node {Canning} is larger.

NC.Q: Between the flows from node Retail Purchase to node Sorting and from node Food Waste to node Canning, which path has a larger flow?

NC.Q: Among the flows from node Retail Purchase to node Canning, from node Food Waste to node Sorting, and from node Trade Agreements to node Food Waste, which path has the largest flow?

NC.Q: Among the flows from node Retail Purchase to node Grinding, from node Food Waste to node Freezing, and from node Customs Clearance to node Food Preparation, which path has the largest flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Customs Clearance} to node {Food Preparation} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which node in the column Consumption of the sankey chart is the most critical?

MSR.Q: What is the path with the highest total flow from source node Customs Clearance to target node Cleaning? Please list all node labels along this path.
